intro: Noccaea magellanica, commonly known as the Magellanic rockcress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as mustard and cabbage. This species typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its small, white or yellowish flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Noccaea magellanica is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in areas with strong winds and limited nutrients.
